RandomFrequencyOnlyModel.cc

00001 #include "RandomFrequencyOnlyModel.h"
00002 
00003 #include "AirFrame_m.h"
00004 
00010 void RandomFrequencyOnlyModel::filterSignal(AirFrame *frame, const Coord& /*sendersPos*/, const Coord& /*receiverPos*/){
00011   Signal& signal = frame->getSignal();
00012 
00013   /* At first get a new instance of the default Mapping implementation
00014    * which is able to represent our attenuation mapping.
00015    * the first parameter of "createMapping" gets the DimensionSet the
00016    * Mapping should use as domain and the second parameter gets the
00017    * interpolation method to be used to calculate the values between
00018    * two Mapping entries.
00019    *
00020    * Note 1: At the moment only LINEAR interpolation is implemented.
00021    *
00022    * Note 2: For now the same interpolation method is used for
00023    * interpolation in every dimension. Later it might be possible
00024    * to define different interpolation methods for different
00025    * dimensions. For example: While linear interpolation of time
00026    * makes sence in most cases, using NEAREST whould make more sense
00027    * for frequency.
00028    */
00029   Mapping* attMapping = MappingUtils::createMapping(Argument::MappedOne, dimensions, Mapping::LINEAR);
00030 
00031   /* Get start and end of the signal to avoid unnecessary calculation
00032    * of attenuation.*/
00033   simtime_t sStart = signal.getReceptionStart();
00034 
00035   // Since this mapping does not depend on time, we just set values for
00036   // the first entry in time-dimension (start of the Signal)
00037   /*
00038   simtime_t sEnd = signal.getReceptionEnd();
00039 
00040   simtime_t interval = 0.01; //lets use constant intervals for entries in time
00041   */
00042 
00043   Argument pos(dimensions); //create an Argument which we will use as parameter
00044                 //to set the values inside the mapping
00045 
00046   pos.setTime(sStart); // set arguments position in time dimension
00047 
00048   for(double freq = 2.412; freq < 2.465; freq += 0.01){
00049 
00050     pos.setArgValue(frequency, freq*1.e9); // update arguments position in frequency dimension
00051 
00052     /*
00053     //create time entries for this frequency
00054     for(simtime_t t = sStart; t <= sEnd; t+=interval){
00055 
00056 
00057       pos.setTime(t); // update arguments position in time dimension
00058     */
00059       /* Create random attenuation between 0.1 and 1.0.
00060        * Since the attenuation value is multiplied to the transmission power mapping
00061        * it should be between 0.0 and 1.0, otherwise it whouldn't be a real
00062        * attenuation.*/
00063       double att = (double)rand() / (double)RAND_MAX * 0.9 + 0.1;
00064 
00065       attMapping->setValue(pos, att); //put the attenuation at the current position into the mapping
00066     /*
00067     }
00068     */
00069   }
00070   //asure attenuation is set at end of freq range
00071   pos.setArgValue(frequency, 2.472e9); // update arguments position in frequency dimension
00072   double att = (double)rand() / (double)RAND_MAX * 0.9 + 0.1;
00073   attMapping->setValue(pos, att); //put the attenuation at the current position into the mapping
00074 
00075   //at last add the created attenuation mapping to the signal
00076   signal.addAttenuation(attMapping);
00077 }
